disclaimerText: This forecast is intended to provide information on expected pollution levels in areas of significant public exposure. It may not apply in very specific locations close to unusually strong or short-lived local sources of pollution.

currentForecast.forecastSummary: Low air pollution forecast valid from Wednesday 16 March to end of Wednesday 16 March GMT
currentForecast.forecastText: Wednesday generally cloudy with rain forecast from afternoon onwards.<br/><br/>A light southerly breeze will become westerly or north-westerly later in the day.<br/><br/>There is a small possibility that with a southerly airflow there may be an import of Saharan dust - which has been affecting southern Europe over the last few days. However any import is not expected to significantly affect air quality with  wash-out in rainfall likely also.  <br/><br/>Air pollution is expected to remain 'Low' throughout the forecast period for the following pollutants:<br/><br/>Nitrogen Dioxide<br/>Ozone<br/>Sulphur Dioxide<br/>PM10 Particulates<br/>PM2.5 Particulates<br/><br/><br/>

currentForecast.forecastSummary: Low air pollution forecast valid from Thursday 17 March to end of Thursday 17 March GMT
currentForecast.forecastText: Thursday is forecast to be bright and sunny with a light westerly airflow.<br/><br/>There may be a build up of local pollution later in the afternoon, due to poor dispersion as the breeze decreases.<br/><br/>Overall, air pollution is expected to remain 'Low' throughout the forecast period for the following pollutants:<br/><br/>Nitrogen Dioxide<br/>Ozone<br/>Sulphur Dioxide<br/>PM10 Particulates<br/>PM2.5 Particulates<br/><br/><br/>
